name: "Little House"  Books Quiz | Kid Lit Authors L - Z | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which one of Almanzo's siblings was not mentioned in any of Laura's books?
questions.explanation:
Laura.

	Laura was afraid this would cause too much confusion.

questions.text: Who was Laura Elizabeth Ingalls named after?
questions.explanation:
Pa's mother.

	Pa's mother's name was Laura Colby Ingalls.

questions.text: What part of the pig did Pa give Mary and Laura to play with after the pig was butchered?
questions.explanation:
the bladder.

	The bladder was blown up and a string tied it closed.  The girls played with it like you would a balloon.

fiddle.

	The Ingalls favorite pastime was to listen to Pa play the fiddle on cold winter nights.

questions.text: What disease did Laura call "fever 'n' ague"?
questions.explanation:
malaria.

	Many people who did not know the real name for malaria called it fever 'n' ague.

questions.text: What were the names of the horses that pulled the wagon from Wisconsin to Kansas?
Where did Mrs. Scott say that fever 'n' ague came from.
questions.explanation:
watermelons.

	Mrs. Scott (the neighbor who took care of the Ingalls when they had malaria) was certain that eating watermelons is what caused fever 'n' ague, and that is what she told the Ingalls.

questions.text: From whom did Pa buy the land next to Plum Creek?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Hansen

	Although Mr. Hansen ran the mill in the series, in the book "On the Banks of Plum Creek", Mr. Hansen actually moved on west after selling the land to Charles.

questions.text: What did Reverand Alden call Mary and Laura in "On the Banks of Plum Creek" his:
questions.explanation:
little country girls.

	Although Laura got quite upset when Nellie called them "country girls" she liked it when Reverand Alden did.

questions.text: What did Pa spend the three dollars he was saving for his new boots on?
questions.explanation:
the church bell.

	When Pa went into town to get his boots, he found out that all the church lacked, was three dollars.  He gave Reverand Alden the money for the bell and put off buying his boots until harvest.

questions.text: What special treat did Ma buy for Mary, Laura, Carrie, and Grace on the train trip from Plum Creek to Silver Lake?
questions.explanation:
Christmas candy.

	When the butcher boy walked by selling the candy, Laura never imagined they would not be able to have any; however, Ma insisted they celebrate their first train ride and paid ten cents for the box of candy.  What a treat they thought.

questions.text: Where did the Ingalls spend their first winter on Silver Lake?
questions.explanation:
the surveyor's house.

	After most of the railroad crew went back east for the winter, the surveyors wanted someone to protect the house and supplies during the winter.  They asked Charles if he would and since he didn't want to be too far from his claim he agreed.

questions.text: Who of these warned the town of the long winter to come?
questions.explanation:
the old Indian.

	The old Indian came in the store warning of heap big snow for seven moons.  Translation, blizzards for seven months.

Royal.

	Almanzo's brother Royal owned a store in DeSmet.  He and Almanzo stayed there during the long winter.

questions.text: What did the Ingalls use to fuel the fire when they ran out of coal in "The Long Winter"?
questions.explanation:
hay sticks.

	Laura and Pa took slough hay and wound it tightly into sticks so they would have some fuel for the fire.  Since the trains couldn't get through, there was no coal to be found.
